A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I have never been more disappointed in a film in my life.  I avoided all pre-film hype\, had no preconceptions or theories I wanted to see on screen\, but was just devastated by how bad this film was.  I wanted it to end about an hour before it actually did\, it makes absolutely no sense\, and feels like a massive practical joke.  I almost hope they could redo this film completely from scratch as the genuine second film of the trilogy and just wipe this one from history.  What a waste of Mark Hamill\, feel so sorry for him that his final chance of playing Luke was this depressing mess.  \nThis appears to be making a lot of money\, will be interested to see whether the next week's box office sees a massive drop.  Please don't encourage them to make more poor films in this vein.  I don't know how they can follow this film and engender any sense of expectation - my desire to see Episode IX is non-existent.  \nRian Johnson has created a terrible movie.
